result.execSummary:
The defendant Trever Lee Leyde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Trever Lee Leyde is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Trever Lee Leyde was found guilty of 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today July 25, 2019 by 3:15 pm.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #16CM57.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #16CM57.

-Sex Offender Evaluation within 60 days and follow recommendations.
-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested by the Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with M.R.C.
-Attend and participate in the Restorative Justice Program within 30 days.
-MRT if requested.
-Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.
-Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA within 30 days and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Gibbs for Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Karl E. Anderson   DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore   DF:  Trever Lee Leyde appeared. Case called at 4:02 pm. Atty Larimore recites agreement. No objection from ADA Anderson. L. Multhaulf has not signed Diversion Agreement. She is currently unavailable. ADA Anderson updates the court.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads No Contest to Count #1. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count #1. Court withholds entering conviction in Count #1 in favor of Diversion Agreement. Counts #2 - #5 are dismissed. km

Status conference at 04-15-2016 10:45 am

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  M.R.C. dob 3/15/1999.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EFV, RPT: Elizabeth Frank, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Megan E. Kelly,  DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore,  DF:  Trever Lee Leyde appeared. Court confirms address.
